item.description:
Willey Range Traverse - featuring Mt. Tom, Mt. Field & Mt. Willey
A perfect hike to assist you in your New Hampshire 48 quest!

Rising sharply to the west of Crawford Notch, the Willey Range is topped by Mounts Tom, Willey & Field. These peaks are close together, and the classic way to bag them is to do all three of them in one trip. On a clear day they afford spectacular views of the Presidential Range, the Pemigewasset Wilderness, the Hancocks and Cardigan.

Our Route:
We will make our way to the summit of Mt. Tom via the Avalon, A-Z & Mt. Tom Spur trails. From the summit of Mt. Tom we will take the Willey Range Trail to the summit of Mt. Field & on to the summit of Mt. Willey. Our descent will be via the Kedron Flume Trail.

Total Distance:
8.55 miles

Book Time:
7 hours, 22 minutes

Meetup Time & Car Spot:
We will meet at 8:45 am at the Kedron Flume Trailhead, located at the Willey House site. We will spot a car here and then take a short drive to the Avalon Trailhead located at the Crawford Station Depot.

Trip Notes:
Mt. Tom, 4,051, is the northern most peak of the Willey Range.

Mount Field is named after Darby Field, who in 1642 made the first known ascent of Mount Washington. At 4,340 feet, Mount Field is the highest peak of the Willey Range.

Mount Willey is named after Samuel Willey, Jr. and his family, who in 1825 moved into a house in Crawford Notch. Tragically the family was killed a year later in August 1826 during a landslide. At 4,285 feet, Mount Willey is the southernmost and second highest in the Wiley Range.

We would like to see at least 3 "yes" RSVP's to create a Meetup. Your assistance on the trail is always welcome and helps in making a Meetup a success.

Please keep your rsvp's up to date. Its very important that we have a true headcount, and not worry that your late or lost. Every hiker is important on a hike, especially if we divide the hike into a fast and slow group, or if there is an injury.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that you are qualified to join us on this White Mountain hiking adventure

Please send your email and cell number when you rsvp to my direct email:
tourbusiness@altazone.com
I will email you a detailed Trip Report outlining our route.

Carpooling is always advised and a great way to get to know your fellow members.

Check out photos from a past Meetup to Tom, Field & Willey at:
http://hiking.meetup....

Disclaimer:
Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.
